newsitem.title: UK: IPE gas oil called up to $1 higher, Brent 5 cts up.
newsitem.headline: IPE gas oil called up to $1 higher, Brent 5 cts up.

text.p: IPE gas oil futures were called to open between 25 cents and $1.00 a tonne higher on Tuesday, while Brent was expected to open around 5 cents higher after sharp gains on Monday, traders said.
June gas oil closed $6.25 higher on Monday at $173.50 a tonne, while June Brent climbed 77 cents to $19.70, having touched a high of $19.89, a level not beaten since March 26.
Dealers said gains were made on a mix of strong investment fund interest and mildly bullish fundamental factors.
These included weekend news of Iranian wargames in the Gulf, talk of thinner North Sea loading programmes and a fishermen's blockade of the Sullom Voe Brent export terminal.
"It was more fund buying than anything else and we broke out of the new trading range...but now we're looking for some stronger fundamental news from the APIs for confirmation," a broker said.
Weekly U.S. stocks data from the American Petroleum Institute are expected to be released after the close of business on Tuesday.
"We're looking to see if gasoline demand is at the same level," a broker said.
Last week's APIs implied record gasoline demand levels, but some market-watchers were sceptical about the validity of the figures.
The next key resistance level for Brent is $20.00, brokers said.
